lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Botty.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Botty.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

Describe the action and its outcome.
* The Botty class represents the main class responsible for interacting with the user and managing tasks.
* It initializes the user interface, task list, parser, and storage components.
* The class reads user input, processes commands, and handles task operations.
* Constructs a new `Botty` instance, initializing user interface, task list, parser, and storage components.
* The constructor also loads the task list from storage.
* Runs the main application loop, interacting with the user, processing commands, and managing tasks.
* The loop continues until the user enters the "bye" command.
return "Sorry, I don't recognise the command, please try another command";
* Represents a deadline task, which is a task that need to be done before a specific date/time.
* Constructs a Deadline object with the specified description and deadline time.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The due date/time for the deadline task.
* Constructs a Deadline object with the specified description and deadline time.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by          The due date/time for the deadline task.
* @param bool        The completion status for the deadline task.
public Deadline(String description, String by, Boolean bool) {
* Returns a string representation of the task's description and completion status for saving.
* @return A formatted string containing completion status and description.
* Represents an event task, which is a task that start at a specific date/time and ends at a specific date/time
* Constructs an Event object with the specified description, start time and end time.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from        The start time for the event.
* @param to          The end time for the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Constructs an Event object with the specified description, start time, end time and completion status.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from        The start time for the event.
* @param to          The end time for the event.
* @param bool        The completion status for the event.

* Returns a string representation of the task's description and completion status for saving.
* @return A formatted string containing completion status and description.
* An abstract class representing a task with a description and completion status.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description and default completion status (false).
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructs a new Task with the given description and specified completion status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param bool      The completion status of the task (true if done, false if not done).
* Returns a string representation of the task's completion status icon.
* @return The completion status icon ("X" if done, " " if not done).
* Returns a string representation of the task's description and completion status for saving.
* @return A formatted string containing completion status and description.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Represents a todo task, which is a task without any date/time attached to it.
* Constructs a Todo object with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Constructs a Todo object with the specified description and mark bool.
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the task's description and completion status for saving.
* @return A formatted string containing completion status and description.

* The Parser class is responsible for parsing user input and generating corresponding commands.
* Parses the user input and returns a command object based on the input.
* @return A command object corresponding to the parsed input.
* @throws UnknownCommandException If the input does not match any recognized command.
* @throws EmptyTodoException      If the input for todo command is empty.
* @throws EmptyChoiceException    If the input for mark or unmark command is missing the task number.
public Command parseInstruction(String input) throws UnknownCommandException, EmptyTodoException, EmptyChoiceException {
throw new EmptyChoiceException(" OOPS!!! Select the task number to be unmarked.\n");
throw new EmptyChoiceException(" OOPS!!! Select the task number to be marked.\n");
throw new EmptyTodoException(" OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.\n");
throw new UnknownCommandException(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n");
* The Storage class handles data storage and retrieval for tasks using files.
* Constructs a new Storage instance with the specified file path.
* Initializes the storage directory and creates the file if it doesn't exist.
* @param filePath The file path within the storage directory.
* Saves the task list's data to the storage file.
* @param taskList The task list containing tasks to be saved.
* Loads task data from the storage file into the task list.
* @param taskList The task list to populate with loaded tasks.
* The TaskList class represents a collection of tasks and provides methods for managing tasks.
* Constructs a new `TaskList` instance with an empty list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Retrieves a task from the task list at the specified index.
* @param i The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Removes a task from the task list.
* @param task The task to be removed.
